articles.headline: As the U.S. Buys Less, Germany Suffers
articles.snippet: The United States, with its credit-driven economy, has long ensured that others, notably China, Germany and Japan, have been able to pile up trade surpluses. Now that dynamic has shifted.
articles.abstract: The United States, with its credit-driven economy, has long ensured that others, notably China, Germany and Japan, have been able to pile up trade surpluses. Now that dynamic has shifted.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUNICH  When American consumers stop buying, companies around the world suffer  even those that do little business in the United States.

articles.headline: Parent Company, a Retailer, Files for Bankruptcy
articles.snippet: The Parent Company, an Internet retailer of children’s products, apparently became the first well-known retailer to file for Chapter 11 protection after Christmas.
articles.abstract: The Parent Company, an Internet retailer of children’s products, apparently became the first well-known retailer to file for Chapter 11 protection after Christmas.
articles.lead_paragraph: A rash of retailing bankruptcies is expected in the new year, but as the clock winds down on one of the weakest holiday shopping seasons in decades, the fallout has already begun.

articles.headline: Mexico’s Fiscal Prudence Fails to Avert a Slowdown
articles.snippet: Mexico is credited for reducing debt and taming inflation, but it has not escaped the pain of global recession.
articles.abstract: Mexico is credited for reducing debt and taming inflation, but it has not escaped the pain of global recession.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY  Twice in the last three decades, Mexico has demonstrated that one country’s profligacy and mismanagement can spell economic catastrophe beyond its borders.

articles.headline: Gazprom, Once Mighty, Is Reeling
articles.snippet: The giant Russian natural gas monopoly is deep in debt and negotiating a government bailout.
articles.abstract: The giant Russian natural gas monopoly is deep in debt and negotiating a government bailout.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  A year ago, Gazprom, the Russian natural gas monopoly, aspired to be the largest corporation in the world. Buoyed by high oil prices and political backing from the Kremlin, it had already achieved third place judging by market capitalization, behind Exxon Mobil and General Electric.

articles.headline: Patient’s DNA May Be Signal to Tailor Medication
articles.snippet: Genetic tests can show which patients are suited to which drugs, but obstacles remain for personalized medicine.
articles.abstract: Genetic tests can show which patients are suited to which drugs, but obstacles remain for personalized medicine.

articles.headline: U.S. Agrees to a Stake in GMAC
articles.snippet: The Treasury Department took a stake of $5 billion in GMAC and agreed to lend $1 billion to to help it reorganize itself as a bank holding company.
articles.abstract: The Treasury Department took a stake of $5 billion in GMAC and agreed to lend $1 billion to to help it reorganize itself as a bank holding company.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department injected $5 billion into GMAC, the automobile financing company, as part of a deal announced Monday night that will let GMAC convert itself into a bank holding company to reduce its borrowing costs and thus borrow money at low rates from the Federal Reserve.
articles.byline: By Edmund L. Andrews and Bill Vlasic

articles.headline: India, an Exporter of Priests, May Keep Them
articles.snippet: As families have fewer children and India’s economy grows, the West may need to look elsewhere to fill its pulpits.
articles.abstract: As families have fewer children and India’s economy grows, the West may need to look elsewhere to fill its pulpits.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALUVA, India  In the sticky night air, next to a grove of mahogany trees, nearly 50 young men in madras shirts saunter back and forth along a basketball court, reciting the rosary.

articles.headline: Breaking Up Is Harder to Do After Housing Fall
articles.snippet: With homes worth less than the mortgage owed, some divorcing couples fight not to get the house.
articles.abstract: With homes worth less than the mortgage owed, some divorcing couples fight not to get the house.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Marci Needle and her husband began to contemplate divorce in June, they thought they had enough money to go their separate ways. They owned a million-dollar home near Atlanta and another in Jacksonville, Fla., as well as investment properties.

articles.headline: Black Workers Hurt by Detroit’s Ills
articles.snippet: Automakers and their higher wage scales provided a route to the middle class for many African-Americans.
articles.abstract: Automakers and their higher wage scales provided a route to the middle class for many African-Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Since millions of African-Americans began leaving Southern farms for Northern factories nearly a century ago in what is still known as the Great Migration, the destinies of many of them have been entwined with the auto industry’s.

articles.headline: Hamas Credo Led It to End Cease-Fire
articles.snippet: The group’s return to military actions against Israel is part of its strategy to appear as Palestinians’ principal resistance.
articles.abstract: The group’s return to military actions against Israel is part of its strategy to appear as Palestinians’ principal resistance.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMALLAH, West Bank  On the wall of the Israeli government press office in Jerusalem on Monday was a stack of yellow Post-it notes pasted one on top of the next, with the number 10,048 scrawled on the top one. That was the number of Palestinian rockets and mortar shells fired into Israel from Gaza since 2001.

articles.headline: Amid a Buildup of Its Forces, Israel Ponders a Cease-Fire
articles.snippet: With air attacks on Gaza heading into a fifth day, Israel was considering a 48-hour cease-fire.
articles.abstract: With air attacks on Gaza heading into a fifth day, Israel was considering a 48-hour cease-fire.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM  With its punishing air attacks on Gaza about to enter a fifth day, its gunboats gathering near the Gaza port and its ground forces poised for imminent action, Israel said Tuesday that it was considering a 48-hour cease-fire that would also require Hamas to stop its rocket fire.
articles.byline: By Ethan Bronner and Taghreed El-Khodary

articles.headline: GMAC Makes It Easier to Get a Car Loan
articles.snippet: The day after an injection from the government, the financing affiliate of G.M. said it would immediately ease the conditions for borrowers to have access to its loans.
articles.abstract: The day after an injection from the government, the financing affiliate of G.M. said it would immediately ease the conditions for borrowers to have access to its loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: The day after it received $6 billion in capital from the federal government, GMAC, the financing affiliate of General Motors, began aggressively trying to draw consumers back into dealerships on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Bill Vlasic
